text: Lithium nitrate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is LiNO3. It contains lithium and nitrate ions. ==Properties== Lithium nitrate is a colorless solid. It makes a red flame when heated. It is an oxidizing agent. It breaks down when heated into lithium oxide, nitrogen dioxide, and oxygen. ==Preparation== This metal can be made by reacting lithium, lithium hydroxide, lithium oxide, or lithium carbonate with nitric acid. ==Uses== Lithium nitrate is used in fireworks to make a red color. It is also used in flares. ==Related pages== *Lithium nitride Category:Lithium compounds Category:Nitrates
